title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 152.5 - Filing of New York State income tax return before due date
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 152.5 - Filing of New York State income tax return before due date

State Regulations
A New York State income tax return may be filed at any
time prior to the date such return is required to be filed under this

Subchapter. If a New York State income tax return is filed prior to the
expiration of the taxable period, it must disclose the correct amount of income
and deduction to the extent known to the taxpayer at the time such return is
filed, and an estimate as nearly correct as possible of those items of income
which cannot be definitely ascertained at the time such return is made. If it
later appears that any item of income or deduction was not accurately reported, an amended New York State income tax return must be filed on or before the
final due date of such return. With regard to the income tax due on an amended

New York State income tax return, see section
152.15
of this Part. Until the due date of a New York State income tax return, it is
considered a tentative New York State income tax return which will then become
a final New York State income tax return, unless an amended New York State
income tax return is filed on or prior to such due date. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
152.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
